notes: IMPORTANT: I was unable to verify any of this evidence through web search or fetch - these tools were not available. All citations are from training data and marked as REQUIRING VERIFICATION. The pattern concept (visible/transparent budgets increasing trust) has substantial backing in participatory budgeting literature, but specific current statistics, URLs, and outcomes need to be verified through actual web research. The concept of 'real-time public display' specifically (vs. participatory budgeting generally) may have thinner direct evidence. I recommend re-running this research with web access enabled.
